Juan Perón

Explanation:
Juan Domingo Perón served as the President of Argentina from October 12, 1973, until his death on July 1, 1974. He was the country's third elected president, serving two terms from 1946 to 1955 before being overthrown in a military coup. He returned to power in 1973 after winning the elections in exile.
